title: Corrado Hérin
text:
Corrado Hérin (pron. <a href="French%20language">fr</a>. : - 4 August 1966 – 31 March 2019) was an Italian <a href="luge">luge</a>r and <a href="mountain%20bike%20racer">mountain bike racer</a>. He died on 31 March 2019 in an ultralight flight accident in Torgnon, Italy.
Biography.
Originally from <a href="F%C3%A9nis">Fénis</a>, <a href="Aosta%20Valley">Aosta Valley</a>, he competed from the mid-1980s to the early 1990s. A natural track luger, he won four medals at the <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Natural%20Track%20Championships">FIL World Luge Natural Track Championships</a> with two gold in the doubles (<a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Natural%20Track%20Championships%201986">1986</a>, <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Natural%20Track%20Championships%201992">1992</a>) and two silvers at the <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Natural%20Track%20Championships%201990">1990</a> event (singles, doubles).
Hérin also won three medals in the men's doubles event at the <a href="FIL%20European%20Luge%20Natural%20Track%20Championships">FIL European Luge Natural Track Championships</a> with one gold (<a href="FIL%20European%20Luge%20Natural%20Track%20Championships%201993">1993</a>) and two silvers (<a href="FIL%20European%20Luge%20Natural%20Track%20Championships%201985">1985</a>, <a href="FIL%20European%20Luge%20Natural%20Track%20Championships%201987">1987</a>).
Hérin was involved with <a href="mountain%20biking">mountain biking</a> during his career in luge during the 1990s, winning a bronze medal in the downhill event at the <a href="UCI%20Mountain%20Bike%20%26amp%3B%20Trials%20World%20Championships">1994 World Mountain Biking Championships</a> in <a href="Vail%2C%20Colorado">Vail, Colorado</a>. He remained active in mountain biking from 1997 to 2002 after retiring from luge.
He won the UCI mountain bike Downhill World cup in 1997 racing for the Sintesi Verlicchi team. In 2016 he returned to racing at the age of 50 and won the Mountain Bike Downhill Masters World Championships in Val Di Sole, Italy.
